name: Japanese-Style (Kewpie) Mayo
description: Japanese-style mayo has a smoother and thinner consistency, tangier character, and depth of spices that distinguishes it from its American brethren.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, whisk together rice vinegar, malt vinegar, salt, MSG, mustard powder, hon-dashi powder, and garlic powder until hon-dashi is completely dissolved.
Place vinegar mixture in the workbowl of a food processor fitted with a steel blade along with the egg yolks. Pulse to combine.
With the motor running, slowly drizzle in vegetable oil in a thin, steady stream. Transfer mayonnaise to an airtight container and store in refrigerator for up to two weeks.
